title: Dudley's dungeon
data:
**Dudley's dungeon** is a *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*-themed webcomic about the adventures of a player character named Dudley.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 History](#History)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Characters](#Characters)

  - [3.1 Dudley](#Dudley)
  - [3.2 Fido](#Fido)
  - [3.3 Dogley](#Dogley)
  - [3.4 Cherry](#Cherry)
  - [3.5 GWTWOD](#GWTWOD)

- [4 Running gags](#Running_gags)

- [5 See also](#See_also)

## History

[![](/images/thumb/3/36/Dudley-NetHack-344-Polymorph.png/300px-Dudley-NetHack-344-Polymorph.png)](/wiki/File:Dudley-NetHack-344-Polymorph.png)



A screenshot of a fan-made comic made in the interface.

The first run of Dudley's dungeon was launched on February 2, 2004, created by Dion Nicolaas and hosted at [his personal website](http://dudley.nicolaas.net) - it would finish on the last day of 2008, and the code used to create the comics would be made available to whoever mailed the author.

From there, two separate continuations appeared:

- The first, hosted at sadowl.com, began on January 12th, 2009, and uses the same code and title as the original version; unfortunately, it has not updated since January 2013, and the site is now defunct. An archive [can be viewed here](https://web.archive.org/web/20180628091143/http://sadowl.com/dudley/index.php) at the Wayback Machine.
- The second continuation, hosted at [alt.org](https://alt.org/nethack/dudley/) and created by [paxed](/wiki/User:Paxed "User:Paxed"), has several differences, most notably [colors](/wiki/Options#color "Options") and a graphical editor. The source code for this comic is available [at github](https://github.com/paxed/dudleysdungeon), and is active as recently as June 2022.

## Description

Dudley's dungeon is set in the world of *NetHack*, where Dudley is the player character seeking the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"). The webcomic is in [ASCII](/wiki/ASCII "ASCII"), like NetHack in [tty](/wiki/Tty "Tty") mode, so you can read it even if your web browser does not load graphics; anyone may design and submit their own version of a Dudley comic to the alt.org site for it to be commented and voted upon when published. However, do not forget to set proper options when reading it from a text browser (such as w3m or lynx), since otherwise popup explanations will interfere with the text of the comic.

## Characters

Over the years, the comic has developed many characters recurring and otherwise.

### Dudley

**Dudley**, @ is the main character of the webcomic. He is introduced in [the first strip](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040202) as a [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") male [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), and uses various other role-race combinations throughout. Dudley gets himself into many of the terrible situations that can also be found in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* and brings out the humor in them - Dudley has a strong aversion to newts, developed from often meeting a comical end at the feet of one.

Dudley has owned several [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") throughout the comic, most notably Fido and Dogley. Other pets have included a [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse") named Horseley, a [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm") named [MyDoom](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MyDoom "wikipedia:MyDoom"), seven [baby black dragons](/wiki/Baby_black_dragon "Baby black dragon") that were promptly separated from Dudley when he fell through a [trap door](/wiki/Trap_door "Trap door").

The two Dudleys of the continuation comics are considered separate characters and are aware of each other's worlds, but have yet to meet face-to-face (as of October 2009).

### Fido

**Fido**, d, is one of Dudley's recurring pets, and first appears in the [February 12, 2004](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040212) strip. Fido is a normal [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog"), with roughly the intelligence of one - while not a particularly good or bad pet, even he [has trouble with newts](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20041129) sometimes.

In [one set of strips](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040412) Fido is turned into a [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon"), then an e (either a [sphere](/wiki/Sphere "Sphere") or [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")), and finally a [demon](/wiki/Demon_\(monster_class\) "Demon (monster class)") of some type.

### Dogley

**Dogley**, d, is another of Dudley's recurring pets, and is likely named as a mix of "Dudley" and "dog" (possibly influenced by Dilbert's dog, Dogbert). He first appears in [the strip for August 19, 2005](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050819), and appears somewhat less often than Fido. Dogley is far more intelligent than a normal dog - certainly moreso than his owner. He is also more competent in combat than Dudley, similar to other pet dogs in many *NetHack* games; he is often turned into a [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") via [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"), and has saved Dudley many times while in dragon form.

Dogley discovered and named the [Dogley Dimension](/wiki/Dogley_Dimension "Dogley Dimension"), also known as an "infinite void" that exists between dungeon levels, via [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode"). The Dogley Dimension is responsible for monster generation, caused by the collisions of floating [hash mark](/wiki/Hash_mark "Hash mark") symbols, and is what causes each [hole](/wiki/Hole "Hole") to drop monsters and objects that fall through them into random squares on the same level. According to Dogley, the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") uses wormholes through this space to connect [staircases](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase").

### Cherry

**Cherry** is an explorer who is on an adventure of her own in the dungeon, and is a neutral female [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice") warrior that seeks the Seed of Life. Dudley regards Cherry as yet another monster, and as a result she tends to be a victim of his usual shenanigans and/or the misfortune that he attracts.

Cherry debuts in a story arc (beginning with [the strip for August 17, 2006](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060817)) where Dudley frequently plays a chaotic male elven wizard. When Dudley hesitates to use a blessed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") on a [cockatrice nest](/wiki/Cockatrice_nest "Cockatrice nest"), [Cherry appears](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060824) and announces her quest for the Seed of Life. This causes Dudley to panic and go through with it, wiping Cherry out along with the cockatrices - her [headstone](/wiki/Headstone "Headstone") reads, "killed by an unrelated plotline".

Cherry re-appears in [the strip for September 25, 2006](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060925), having started another game, and locates a "human rogue called Dudley". Before she can attack him in retaliation, a [mail daemon](/wiki/Mail_daemon "Mail daemon") rushes to deliver a message to Dudley, shoving Cherry into a fountain and killing her - her headstone reads, "drowned in a deluge of mail".

Cherry starts a third game in the [February 23, 2007](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20070223) strip, prepared to solve her Dudley problem by using a blessed scroll of genocide against @. Unfortunately for her, Dudley kills Cherry and takes her [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") to use against some weak monsters, though she still complains all the while. Cherry gets the last laugh when Dudley falls into a [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit") while holding her corpse and is turned to stone.

The [February 7, 2008](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20080207) strip shows Cherry in the middle of another game, suddenly meeting Dudley in a corridor. Cherry has an uncursed scroll of genocide, and uses it to genocide [humans](/wiki/Human_\(monster\) "Human (monster)"). The [showrace](/wiki/Showrace "Showrace") option then reveals that Dudley is currently a dwarf, and he attacks Cherry.

The [June 30, 2008](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20080630) strip has Cherry facing the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") and wondering why the Wizard keeps returning when she can simply stone him.

Cherry's last appearance in the original comic is the [August 7, 2008](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20080807) strip, where Dudley finds a tin of Cherry's meat; he eats it, mistaking the "Cherry" in the tin for fruit, and is turned to stone.

### GWTWOD

The [Gnome With the Wand of Death](/wiki/Gnome_With_the_Wand_of_Death "Gnome With the Wand of Death") (GWTWOD) is a recurring character that first appears in [the May 31, 2005 strip](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050531\&q=gnome). As implied by the name, the gnome's primary motive is to kill Dudley at inconvenient and unexpected moments.

## Running gags

- [Newts](/wiki/Newt "Newt"): The punchlines of earlier strips frequently involved Dudley dying at the hands of incredibly weak monsters, with newts becoming the most common by far - [this strip](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040323) features the very first newt death. Around the time of the continuations, the joke was eventually criticized as overused, and most strips featuring newts killing Dudley are usually rated poorly and referred to as "newt jokes" or **YANC** ("Yet Another Newt Comic"). Comments posted by [L](/wiki/L_\(person\) "L (person)") keep track of the various newt comics from the first run with a decent level of accuracy.
  - **Newtbane** was a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") [named by Dudley](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050428) in the hopes that it would enable him to kill newts more easily, similar to artifacts like [Sting](/wiki/Sting "Sting") and [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist"); he was then killed by a newt similarly named **Dudleyrist**.
- **Yet another meta strip** - a strip whose humor relies on commentary about the comic's jokes or other meta-comic tropes, Many of these strips also involve newts in some manner.
- [YASD](/wiki/YASD "YASD"): The primary source of humor in the comic is Dudley (and sometimes other monsters) dying in all sorts of inexplicable manners.

## See also

- An archived [Comixpedia page](https://web.archive.org/web/20130404215409/http://www.comixpedia.org/index.php?title=Dudley%27s_dungeon) about the webcomic
- [Dudley's dungeon](https://allthetropes.org/wiki/Dudley's_dungeon) on All The Tropes

[![This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/58/Noversion.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Dudley's dungeon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Dudley's dungeon is a NetHack-themed webcomic about the adventures of a player character named Dudley.

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Characters
    • 3.1 Dudley
    • 3.2 Fido
    • 3.3 Dogley
    • 3.4 Cherry
    • 3.5 GWTWOD
  • 4 Running gags
  • 5 See also

History

A screenshot of a fan-made comic made in the interface.

The first run of Dudley's dungeon was launched on February 2, 2004, created by Dion Nicolaas and hosted at his personal website - it would finish on the last day of 2008, and the code used to create the comics would be made available to whoever mailed the author.

From there, two separate continuations appeared:

  • The first, hosted at sadowl.com, began on January 12th, 2009, and uses the same code and title as the original version; unfortunately, it has not updated since January 2013, and the site is now defunct. An archive can be viewed here at the Wayback Machine.
  • The second continuation, hosted at alt.org and created by paxed, has several differences, most notably colors and a graphical editor. The source code for this comic is available at github, and is active as recently as June 2022.

Description

Dudley's dungeon is set in the world of NetHack, where Dudley is the player character seeking the Amulet of Yendor. The webcomic is in ASCII, like NetHack in tty mode, so you can read it even if your web browser does not load graphics; anyone may design and submit their own version of a Dudley comic to the alt.org site for it to be commented and voted upon when published. However, do not forget to set proper options when reading it from a text browser (such as w3m or lynx), since otherwise popup explanations will interfere with the text of the comic.

Characters

Over the years, the comic has developed many characters recurring and otherwise.

Dudley

Dudley, @ is the main character of the webcomic. He is introduced in the first strip as a chaotic male human Rogue, and uses various other role-race combinations throughout. Dudley gets himself into many of the terrible situations that can also be found in NetHack and brings out the humor in them - Dudley has a strong aversion to newts, developed from often meeting a comical end at the feet of one.

Dudley has owned several pets throughout the comic, most notably Fido and Dogley. Other pets have included a horse named Horseley, a long worm named MyDoom, seven baby black dragons that were promptly separated from Dudley when he fell through a trap door.

The two Dudleys of the continuation comics are considered separate characters and are aware of each other's worlds, but have yet to meet face-to-face (as of October 2009).

Fido

Fido, d, is one of Dudley's recurring pets, and first appears in the February 12, 2004 strip. Fido is a normal dog, with roughly the intelligence of one - while not a particularly good or bad pet, even he has trouble with newts sometimes.

In one set of strips Fido is turned into a dragon, then an e (either a sphere or floating eye), and finally a demon of some type.

Dogley

Dogley, d, is another of Dudley's recurring pets, and is likely named as a mix of "Dudley" and "dog" (possibly influenced by Dilbert's dog, Dogbert). He first appears in the strip for August 19, 2005, and appears somewhat less often than Fido. Dogley is far more intelligent than a normal dog - certainly moreso than his owner. He is also more competent in combat than Dudley, similar to other pet dogs in many NetHack games; he is often turned into a dragon via polymorph, and has saved Dudley many times while in dragon form.

Dogley discovered and named the Dogley Dimension, also known as an "infinite void" that exists between dungeon levels, via wizard mode. The Dogley Dimension is responsible for monster generation, caused by the collisions of floating hash mark symbols, and is what causes each hole to drop monsters and objects that fall through them into random squares on the same level. According to Dogley, the Wizard of Yendor uses wormholes through this space to connect staircases.

Cherry

Cherry is an explorer who is on an adventure of her own in the dungeon, and is a neutral female chickatrice warrior that seeks the Seed of Life. Dudley regards Cherry as yet another monster, and as a result she tends to be a victim of his usual shenanigans and/or the misfortune that he attracts.

Cherry debuts in a story arc (beginning with the strip for August 17, 2006) where Dudley frequently plays a chaotic male elven wizard. When Dudley hesitates to use a blessed scroll of genocide on a cockatrice nest, Cherry appears and announces her quest for the Seed of Life. This causes Dudley to panic and go through with it, wiping Cherry out along with the cockatrices - her headstone reads, "killed by an unrelated plotline".

Cherry re-appears in the strip for September 25, 2006, having started another game, and locates a "human rogue called Dudley". Before she can attack him in retaliation, a mail daemon rushes to deliver a message to Dudley, shoving Cherry into a fountain and killing her - her headstone reads, "drowned in a deluge of mail".

Cherry starts a third game in the February 23, 2007 strip, prepared to solve her Dudley problem by using a blessed scroll of genocide against @. Unfortunately for her, Dudley kills Cherry and takes her corpse to use against some weak monsters, though she still complains all the while. Cherry gets the last laugh when Dudley falls into a pit while holding her corpse and is turned to stone.

The February 7, 2008 strip shows Cherry in the middle of another game, suddenly meeting Dudley in a corridor. Cherry has an uncursed scroll of genocide, and uses it to genocide humans. The showrace option then reveals that Dudley is currently a dwarf, and he attacks Cherry.

The June 30, 2008 strip has Cherry facing the Wizard of Yendor and wondering why the Wizard keeps returning when she can simply stone him.

Cherry's last appearance in the original comic is the August 7, 2008 strip, where Dudley finds a tin of Cherry's meat; he eats it, mistaking the "Cherry" in the tin for fruit, and is turned to stone.

GWTWOD

The Gnome With the Wand of Death (GWTWOD) is a recurring character that first appears in the May 31, 2005 strip. As implied by the name, the gnome's primary motive is to kill Dudley at inconvenient and unexpected moments.

Running gags

  • Newts: The punchlines of earlier strips frequently involved Dudley dying at the hands of incredibly weak monsters, with newts becoming the most common by far - this strip features the very first newt death. Around the time of the continuations, the joke was eventually criticized as overused, and most strips featuring newts killing Dudley are usually rated poorly and referred to as "newt jokes" or YANC ("Yet Another Newt Comic"). Comments posted by L keep track of the various newt comics from the first run with a decent level of accuracy.
    • Newtbane was a long sword named by Dudley in the hopes that it would enable him to kill newts more easily, similar to artifacts like Sting and Orcrist; he was then killed by a newt similarly named Dudleyrist.
  • Yet another meta strip - a strip whose humor relies on commentary about the comic's jokes or other meta-comic tropes, Many of these strips also involve newts in some manner.
  • YASD: The primary source of humor in the comic is Dudley (and sometimes other monsters) dying in all sorts of inexplicable manners.

See also

  • An archived Comixpedia page about the webcomic
  • Dudley's dungeon on All The Tropes

rawPage:
'''Dudley's dungeon''' is a ''[[NetHack]]''-themed webcomic about the adventures of a player character named Dudley.

==History==
[[File:Dudley-NetHack-344-Polymorph.png|thumb|right|A screenshot of a fan-made comic made in the interface.]]
The first run of Dudley's dungeon was launched on February 2, 2004, created by Dion Nicolaas and hosted at [http://dudley.nicolaas.net his personal website] - it would finish on the last day of 2008, and the code used to create the comics would be made available to whoever mailed the author.

From there, two separate continuations appeared:
* The first, hosted at sadowl.com, began on January 12th, 2009, and uses the same code and title as the original version; unfortunately, it has not updated since January 2013, and the site is now defunct. An archive [https://web.archive.org/web/20180628091143/http://sadowl.com/dudley/index.php can be viewed here] at the Wayback Machine.
* The second continuation, hosted at [https://alt.org/nethack/dudley/ alt.org] and created by [[User:Paxed|paxed]], has several differences, most notably [[Options#color|colors]] and a graphical editor. The source code for this comic is available [https://github.com/paxed/dudleysdungeon at github], and is active as recently as June 2022.

==Description==
Dudley's dungeon is set in the world of ''NetHack'', where Dudley is the player character seeking the [[Amulet of Yendor]]. The webcomic is in [[ASCII]], like NetHack in [[tty]] mode, so you can read it even if your web browser does not load graphics; anyone may design and submit their own version of a Dudley comic to the alt.org site for it to be commented and voted upon when published. However, do not forget to set proper options when reading it from a text browser (such as w3m or lynx), since otherwise popup explanations will interfere with the text of the comic.

==Characters==
Over the years, the comic has developed many characters recurring and otherwise.

===Dudley===
'''Dudley''', {{white|@}} is the main character of the webcomic. He is introduced in [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040202 the first strip] as a [[chaotic]] male [[Human (monster attribute)|human]] [[Rogue]], and uses various other role-race combinations throughout. Dudley gets himself into many of the terrible situations that can also be found in ''[[NetHack]]'' and brings out the humor in them - Dudley has a strong aversion to newts, developed from often meeting a comical end at the feet of one.

Dudley has owned several [[pet]]s throughout the comic, most notably Fido and Dogley. Other pets have included a [[horse]] named Horseley, a [[long worm]] named [[wikipedia:MyDoom|MyDoom]], seven [[baby black dragon]]s that were promptly separated from Dudley when he fell through a [[trap door]].

The two Dudleys of the continuation comics are considered separate characters and are aware of each other's worlds, but have yet to meet face-to-face (as of October 2009).<!--Check this when you get a chance...-->

===Fido===
'''Fido''', {{white|d}}, is one of Dudley's recurring pets, and first appears in the [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040212 February 12, 2004] strip. Fido is a normal [[dog]], with roughly the intelligence of one - while not a particularly good or bad pet, even he [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20041129 has trouble with newts] sometimes.

In [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040412 one set of strips] Fido is turned into a [[dragon]], then an {{white|e}} (either a [[sphere]] or [[floating eye]]), and finally a [[Demon (monster class)|demon]] of some type.

===Dogley===
'''Dogley''', {{white|d}}, is another of Dudley's recurring pets, and is likely named as a mix of "Dudley" and "dog" (possibly influenced by Dilbert's dog, Dogbert). He  first appears in [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050819 the strip for August 19, 2005], and appears somewhat less often than Fido. Dogley is far more intelligent than a normal dog - certainly moreso than his owner. He is also more competent in combat than Dudley, similar to other pet dogs in many ''NetHack'' games; he is often turned into a [[dragon]] via [[polymorph]], and has saved Dudley many times while in dragon form.

Dogley discovered and named the [[Dogley Dimension]], also known as an "infinite void" that exists between dungeon levels, via [[wizard mode]]. The Dogley Dimension is responsible for monster generation, caused by the collisions of floating [[hash mark]] symbols, and is what causes each [[hole]] to drop monsters and objects that fall through them into random squares on the same level. According to Dogley, the [[Wizard of Yendor]] uses wormholes through this space to connect [[staircase]]s.

===Cherry===
'''Cherry''' is an explorer who is on an adventure of her own in the dungeon, and is a neutral female [[chickatrice]] warrior that seeks the Seed of Life. Dudley regards Cherry as yet another monster, and as a result she tends to be a victim of his usual shenanigans and/or the misfortune that he attracts.

Cherry debuts in a story arc (beginning with [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060817 the strip for August 17, 2006]) where Dudley frequently plays a chaotic male elven wizard. When Dudley hesitates to use a blessed [[scroll of genocide]] on a [[cockatrice nest]], [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060824 Cherry appears] and announces her quest for the Seed of Life. This causes Dudley to panic and go through with it, wiping Cherry out along with the cockatrices - her [[headstone]] reads, "killed by an unrelated plotline".

Cherry re-appears in [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060925 the strip for September 25, 2006], having started another game, and locates a "human rogue called Dudley". Before she can attack him in retaliation, a [[mail daemon]] rushes to deliver a message to Dudley, shoving Cherry into a fountain and killing her - her headstone reads, "drowned in a deluge of mail".

Cherry starts a third game in the [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20070223 February 23, 2007] strip, prepared to solve her Dudley problem by using a blessed scroll of genocide against {{white|@}}. Unfortunately for her, Dudley kills Cherry and takes her [[corpse]] to use against some weak monsters, though she still complains all the while. Cherry gets the last laugh when Dudley falls into a [[pit]] while holding her corpse and is turned to stone.

The [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20080207 February 7, 2008] strip shows Cherry in the middle of another game, suddenly meeting Dudley in a corridor. Cherry has an uncursed scroll of genocide, and uses it to genocide [[Human (monster)|humans]]. The [[showrace]] option then reveals that Dudley is currently a dwarf, and he attacks Cherry.

The [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20080630 June 30, 2008] strip has Cherry facing the [[Wizard of Yendor]] and wondering why the Wizard keeps returning when she can simply stone him.

Cherry's last appearance in the original comic is the [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20080807 August 7, 2008] strip, where Dudley finds a tin of Cherry's meat; he eats it, mistaking the "Cherry" in the tin for fruit, and is turned to stone.

===GWTWOD===
The [[Gnome With the Wand of Death]] (GWTWOD) is a recurring character that first appears in [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050531&q=gnome the May 31, 2005 strip]. As implied by the name, the gnome's primary motive is to kill Dudley at inconvenient and unexpected moments.

==Running gags==
* [[Newt]]s: The punchlines of earlier strips frequently involved Dudley dying at the hands of incredibly weak monsters, with newts becoming the most common by far - [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20040323 this strip] features the very first newt death. Around the time of the continuations, the joke was eventually criticized as overused, and most strips featuring newts killing Dudley are usually rated poorly and referred to as "newt jokes" or '''YANC''' ("Yet Another Newt Comic"). Comments posted by [[L (person)|L]] keep track of the various newt comics from the first run with a decent level of accuracy.
** '''Newtbane''' was a [[long sword]] [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050428 named by Dudley] in the hopes that it would enable him to kill newts more easily, similar to artifacts like [[Sting]] and [[Orcrist]]; he was then killed by a newt similarly named '''Dudleyrist'''.
* '''Yet another meta strip''' - a strip whose humor relies on commentary about the comic's jokes or other meta-comic tropes, Many of these strips also involve newts in some manner.
* [[YASD]]: The primary source of humor in the comic is Dudley (and sometimes other monsters) dying in all sorts of inexplicable manners.

==See also==
* An archived [https://web.archive.org/web/20130404215409/http://www.comixpedia.org/index.php?title=Dudley%27s_dungeon Comixpedia page] about the webcomic
* [https://allthetropes.org/wiki/Dudley's_dungeon Dudley's dungeon] on All The Tropes
{{noversion}}
